description: On 24 March 2020, the President of the Democratic Republic of the Congo declared a 30-day long State of Emergency to control the spread of COVID-19.
As of March 21, 2020 The Republic of Congo closed its borders and all international passenger flights are suspended
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: DRC closes all international borders on March 25.

Democratic Republic of the Congo
August 15, 2020
External border restrictions were lifted
Airports, ports, and borders reopened August 15. All travelers must present a negative COVID-19 PCR test result taken within 72 hours. Additional screening measures will also be implemented upon arrival.

Democratic Republic of the Congo
August 15, 2020
External border restrictions were lifted
Airports, ports, and borders reopened August 15. All travelers must present a negative COVID-19 PCR test result taken within 72 hours. Additional screening measures will also be implemented upon arrival.

Democratic Republic of the Congo implements health checks at the airports for all passengers starting on March 10. Those who show symptoms will be moved to government facilities for further testing, and those who test positive for Covid-19 will be hospitalized at government expense.
DRC bans travel between Kinshasa and all other regions in the country.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: On March 23, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Haut-Katanga imposed a 2-day confinement on the entire region. The measure was taken after two people who arrived on a Congo Airways plane tested postive for coronavirus arrived to the city of Lubumbashi. This 48-hour confinement was announced in order to trace the other travelers aboard this flight and was enforced by the military and police.

On 28 March, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Kinshasa imposed a 3-week confinement on the entire region. The population will be authorized to go out two days per week to purchase food and other basic necessities. Only administrative staff providing minimum services as well as healthcare personnel will be allowed to circulate.
link: NA ; https://www.bbc.com/afrique/region-52057717 ; BBC News | Afrique ; La capitale congolaise sera sous confinement total dès ce samedi ; https://afrique.lalibre.be/48352/rd-congo-confinement-intermittent-a-kinshasa/

description: On 6 April, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Nord Kivu imposed a 14-day confinement on the cities of Goma, Beni, and Butembo Only vehicles without passengers transporting food and basic necessities are allowed to circulate.
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On April 6, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Kinshasa imposed a 14-day confinement on the eastern city of Gombe. The measures are enforced by the provincial police with threat of fines and/or imprisonment. Gombe is considered the political, diplomatic and economic hub of the DRC as well as its "epidemic epicenter". Healthcare personnel, journalists and employees of banks and telecommunications services will be allowed to circulate freely while a maximum of 10 persons per company are authorized to enter Gombe.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: On May 20, 2020, the Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Kinshasa imposed a 14-day lockdown on the eastern city of Gombe. The provisions of which include a police-enforced mandatory curfew from 8:00 pm to 5:00 am. The police have limited movement within city limits by setting up roadblocks as well as by detaining or imposing fines [20,000 to 200,000 Congolese francs ($11 to $110)] on those found in violation of the new curfew.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: The Democratic Republic of the Congo is enforcing a 14-day self-quarantine on passengers having traveled to China, France, Germany, Italy, Iran, South Korea, and Iraq in the 14 days prior to their arrival into the country but who show no symptoms at their time of arrival. Passengers who transited in the countries but did not leave the airport are subject to no restrictions.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: All travelers entering the DRC who have a fever will be tested, and any persons positive for COVID-19 will be hospitalized at DRC government expense. Both categories will be subject to a mandatory 14-day quarantine.  All persons traveling domestically from Kinshasa to other provinces will be subject to preventative screening.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
